errors.pageNotFound: Sorry, I could not find any page with that URI.
errors.pageNotFoundDescription: There seems to be an error in the URI you followed here.
errors.noSuchEntity: Sorry, I could not find any entity with ID “{entityId}”.
errors.noSuchEntityDescription: Maybe it was deleted. Maybe it never existed. Maybe we'll never know.
errors.invalidEntity: Sorry, I could not parse “{entityId}” as a valid entity ID.
errors.invalidEntityDescription: While trying to read “{entityId}” as an entity ID, this error occured: “{error}”.
errors.underConstruction: Sorry, this part of SQID is still under construction.
errors.underConstructionDescription: This rewrite of SQID is still under development. For the moment, you can still use {sqid}.

entity.noSuperProperties: {subpropertyOf}: {property} is not a subproperty of any other property
entity.noInstanceClasses: {instanceOf}: {instance} is not an instance of any other class
entity.noSuperClasses: {subclassOf}: {class} is not a subclass of any other class
entity.allInstancesDescription: Total number of unique instances of this class and its {num} direct and indirect subclasses
entity.classTypicalPropertiesDescription: Properties typically used by direct and indirect instances of this class
entity.directSubclassesInstancesDescription: Direct subclasess that have instances, together with the number of their direct and indirect instances
entity.directSubclassesSubclassesDescription: Direct subclasses that have subclasses, together with the number of their direct and indirect subclasses
entity.allSubclassesDescription: Number of unique direct and indirect subclasses
entity.propertyEntitiesDescription: Entities with some statement for this property
entity.propertyValuesDescription: Values used in some statement with this property
entity.propertyTypicalPropertiesDescription: Other properties typically used by entities using this property
entity.propertyStatementsDescription: Number of statements for this property
entity.propertyQualifiersDescription: Other properties that are used as qualifiers for this property, together with the number of uses

home.description: SQID is a fast way to browse and query {wikidata}, the free knowledge base of Wikipedia. SQID is inspired by Magnus Manske's {reasonator}, but it has a different focus. In particular, information about Wikidata classes and properties is prominently shown, including derived statistics and query results that are not part of Wikidata. SQID wants to help editors to improve Wikidata.
home.examplesBach: {bach}: classical example of a data-rich item page
home.examplesVolcano: {volcano}: Wikidata item that is used as a class
home.examplesGalaxy: {galaxy}: Wikidata class item that is part of the rather well-designed classification of astronomical objects
home.examplesProperty: {property}: the class of all Wikidata properties; shows how properties are organised in subclasses
home.propertiesDescription: {properties} are special Wikidata entities that are used for describing relationships between entities, and for assigning many types of data values to entities. You can find all properties in SQID's {propertyBrowser}.
home.classesDescription: {classes} are Wikidata items that are used as the value in an {instanceOf} statement, or that are subject or value in a {subclassOf} statement. You can find all classes in SQID's {classBrowser}
home.data: Most data shown by SQID is {liveData} taken from the {wikidataAPI}  or the {wdqs}. Complex statistics that cannot currently be computed live are pre-computed from the weekly data dumps using {wdtk}. Some complex statistics can be fetched from SPARQL, but take too long to compute in the browser. These are updated every hour. See the {statusPage} for recency information and statistics on the current data.

status.statusOverview: This page reports on the current status of the data shown in the system. Data is cached in your browser. More recent data may be available on the server.
status.refreshCycle: Statistical data is computed from the data dump about once per week. Basic statisics (class and property names, usage counts for properties, direct instances of classes) are refreshed more frequently, about once per hour. All other data is live.

about.aboutDescription: SQID is a project of the {kbsGroup} of {tuDresden}. Developers include {developersList}, and {lastDeveloper}.
about.aboutImplementation: SQID is programmed in TypeScript with additional server-side code in Java and Python to extract, query, and preprocess data.
about.meaningHypotheses: The origin of the name is unknown, but it seems to be an abbreviation of something. Current hypotheses include: {hypotheses} Another possible theory is that the name is indeed inspired by the high intelligence, amazing social skills, and sharp vision that are characteristic for many {squids} and Wikidata editors alike.
about.contribute: Where can I make comments and contributions?
about.contributions: All code is found in our {githubRepository}. Bugs and wishes are best reported by {submitIssue}. Pull requests are welcome.
